title: The investing mental map: goal, time horizon, risk, return

questions.prompt: In Limpid's approach, investing starts with:

choices.text: Finding the best ETF of the moment
Defining your goal, time horizon, and acceptable risk

questions.explanation: Without a goal/horizon/risk framework, you can't judge whether a choice is coherent. The product comes after the framework.
Risk means the final outcome can be very different from what you expected, including losses.

choices.text: The number of holdings in your portfolio

questions.explanation: Capacity is factual: it measures your real margin to absorb a drop without putting yourself at risk.

choices.text: Reduce dependence on a single scenario

questions.explanation: Diversification reduces the 'single bet' risk without eliminating the possibility of an overall decline.

questions.prompt: True/False: a long time horizon eliminates all risk.
questions.explanation: A long horizon helps absorb temporary drops, but risk doesn't disappear: it changes form.
